title: A New Toolbox to Label Zinc-MTF1 Responsive Neuronal Populations Unravels Cellular Congruence between MTF1 Responses and T-type Calcium Channelopathies in an Experimental Model of Epilepsy.
abstract: Temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) is one of the most common forms of epilepsy and usually manifests after serious brain insults, including traumatic brain injury, stroke, and status epilepticus (SE). Previously, we identified a new epilepsy-associated transcriptional control mechanism that relies on the zinc-dependent transcriptional activator metal-regulatory transcription factor-1 (MTF1). MTF1 is one of the key transcription factors involved in intracellular metal ion balance.
